main event: An object described as a bright light, approximately three times brighter than the brightest star in the sky, was observed by employees at Thule Air Base, Greenland on April 15, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed coming from the south over the horizon, traveling in a northerly direction at a very high rate of speed and at an extremely high altitude.
The object was circular in shape and extremely bright, with no sound or exhaust perceived.
The object made an abrupt turnabout and accelerated from view.
The sighting lasted for approximately 3-4 minutes.
The report states that the source was unable to distinguish whether the object was an aircraft or had distinguishing points of a vapor trail, even with binoculars.
sighted object: a bright light, approximately three times brighter than the brightest star in the sky, in a circular shape
